title: Free of moderator abuse by design, huh?

body: It's only okay if milkit is doing it to censor people opposing him
body_html: It's only okay if milkit is doing it to censor people opposing him

guild.description:
The official guild for all things Ruqqus.

Rules:

💻 No promotion of other sites that aren't a fork of Ruqqus

🟪 Ruqqus-related only. This is a community dedicated to Ruqqus meta discussion. Content may involve technology and politics but must have ample context in Ruqqus.

📬 No spamming. Spamming comments or posts is not allowed.

😀 Be civil. Be nice. Harassment, trolling, and disruptive behavior is not allowed. Basically, don’t be a jerk.

📜 Follow Ruqqus ToS. This is a given.

For press releases, visit +RuqqusPress.

For updates and patch notes, visit +changelog.

For ideas and feedback, visit +BetaFeedback

For bug reports, visit +RuqqusBugs

The official guild for all things Ruqqus.

Rules:

💻 No promotion of other sites that aren't a fork of Ruqqus

🟪 Ruqqus-related only. This is a community dedicated to Ruqqus meta discussion. Content may involve technology and politics but must have ample context in Ruqqus.

📬 No spamming. Spamming comments or posts is not allowed.

😀 Be civil. Be nice. Harassment, trolling, and disruptive behavior is not allowed. Basically, don’t be a jerk.

📜 Follow Ruqqus ToS. This is a given.

For ideas and feedback, visit +BetaFeedback

For bug reports, visit +RuqqusBugs
guild.name: Ruqqus

post.title: Free of moderator abuse by design, huh?

body:
There's a difference between the original GM of a guild and sieging the guild to take power. Both instances can still have power GMs who can be abusive moderators (as many consider @milkit), but with sieges there's no credibility to the new GM.

They didn't create the guild. Often it's hijacking like this instance make the new GM worse than the original GM.

Hijacking has almost no credibility to the GMs who then go on to exile half the guild, kick almost all the posts, and then flip the guild on its head.

I agree censorship is bad, but milkit is practically an angel compared to a lot of the hijacking GMs we see. Even compared, I wouldn't say @milkit is perfect or not censoring people. But at the same time, I'm glad he exiles annoying shills, and if they don't like how he runs his guild they have every opportunity to create their own (+LeMemery).

However, all hijacking does is destroy. It destroys guilds, it alienates the original members, it is the pinnacle of moderator abuse, and it quite frankly is a big detractor of the site right now.

I've made a long post about my opinion of sieging here: https://ruqqus.com/+SiegedGuilds/post/5szv/my-general-opinion-on-sieging-probably

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.

body: Cap found a loophole to call @JosephGoobbels an "alt" used to evade the guild limit, banning him permanently for something that's supposed to be a 7-day ban. Abusive captainmeta4-like guildmaster carpathianflorist then seiged the guild *immediately* afterwards. Totally not suspicious <sup>/s</sup>
body_html: Cap found a loophole to call @JosephGoobbels an "alt" used to evade the guild limit, banning him permanently for something that's supposed to be a 7-day ban. Abusive captainmeta4-like guildmaster carpathianflorist then seiged the guild immediately afterwards. Totally not suspicious /s

author.bio: 12/08/2021 The administrators are no longer committed to free speech on this website, but they will continue to develop the software so that anyone who is interested in hosting a free speech website can do so. Rest in peace, Ruqqus. It was nice.

🟪 Ruqqus-related only. This is a community dedicated to Ruqqus meta discussion. Content may involve technology and politics but must have ample context in Ruqqus.

📬 No spamming. Spamming comments or posts is not allowed.

😀 Be civil. Be nice. Harassment, trolling, and disruptive behavior is not allowed. Basically, don’t be a jerk.

📜 Follow Ruqqus ToS. This is a given.

For updates and patch notes, visit +changelog.

For ideas and feedback, visit +BetaFeedback

For bug reports, visit +RuqqusBugs

post.title: Free of moderator abuse by design, huh?

body:
It's not unparalleled transparency. A lot of other sites, like formerly Voat, used to show modlogs with reasons as well. This isn't new, despite the admins pushing the facade of reinventing the wheel here.

I'm all for modlogs, but they're just showing how abusable the platform is. Don't get me wrong, modlogs are great, but now that we have this effective spotlight on every guild we should actually focus on holding abusive mods accountable.
body_html:
It's not unparalleled transparency. A lot of other sites, like formerly Voat, used to show modlogs with reasons as well. This isn't new, despite the admins pushing the facade of reinventing the wheel here.

I'm all for modlogs, but they're just showing how abusable the platform is. Don't get me wrong, modlogs are great, but now that we have this effective spotlight on every guild we should actually focus on holding abusive mods accountable.

parent.body: Cap found a loophole to call @JosephGoobbels an "alt" used to evade the guild limit, banning him permanently for something that's supposed to be a 7-day ban. Abusive captainmeta4-like guildmaster carpathianflorist then seiged the guild *immediately* afterwards. Totally not suspicious <sup>/s</sup>
parent.body_html: Cap found a loophole to call @JosephGoobbels an "alt" used to evade the guild limit, banning him permanently for something that's supposed to be a 7-day ban. Abusive captainmeta4-like guildmaster carpathianflorist then seiged the guild immediately afterwards. Totally not suspicious /s

post.title: Free of moderator abuse by design, huh?

author.bio: More interested in decentralization and federation now. I hope learn software, web development to build and bring us free platforms. Goodbye
author.bio_html: More interested in decentralization and federation now. I hope learn software, web development to build and bring us free platforms. Goodbye

body: This has already been reversed. Free of moderator abuse, to the admins, means free of moderators controlling multiple guilds and the narratives. It also means kicking posts to +General. However, they believe that a moderator, in one of their own guilds, has the power to do as they please, exiling users and kicking posts as they see fit. I've actually talked to Kek in Discord a long time ago about mod abuse in individual guilds, and he said that if there were a troublesome mod, it was up to the community to make their own separate guild of the same topic as that original guild, with no abusive mods in control
body_html: This has already been reversed. Free of moderator abuse, to the admins, means free of moderators controlling multiple guilds and the narratives. It also means kicking posts to +general. However, they believe that a moderator, in one of their own guilds, has the power to do as they please, exiling users and kicking posts as they see fit. I've actually talked to Kek in Discord a long time ago about mod abuse in individual guilds, and he said that if there were a troublesome mod, it was up to the community to make their own separate guild of the same topic as that original guild, with no abusive mods in control
